summary: Valentine’s Day website to ask the user’s wife to be their Valentine.
architectural_notes: Email-sending feature requires backend/server capability or third-party email service integration; cannot be client-only.
Capture/submit of post-Yes comments implies form handling and data transmission to backend/email service.
Do not hotlink external pig images; download/convert them into local static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and update the decorative elements to reference those local files.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine’s Day website experience that asks the user’s wife: “Will you be my Valentine?” and presents clear interactive choices.

Implement engaging response states: selecting “Yes” shows a celebratory view (e.g., hearts/confetti animation and a romantic confirmation message), and selecting “No” shows a gentle, playful alternative response without being offensive or manipulative.
Add a simple personalization section (client-side only) so the user can set a short message and names (e.g., “To: [Name]”, “From: [Name]”) that appear on the main card/page.

Apply a cohesive, distinctive visual theme suitable for a Valentine’s Day romantic card (consistent colors, typography, spacing, and components across all states). Do not use a blue/purple primary palette.
Ensure accessibility and usability basics: keyboard navigability for all interactive elements, visible focus states, and appropriate semantic structure for headings/buttons.
Add the required generated image assets into the frontend as static files and use them in the UI (served from frontend/public/assets/generated).
Remove the personalization UI entirely (no "To" / "From" fields and no editable text box) and stop collecting any user-entered personalization data on the question screen.
Replace the previous user-editable note/to/from area with a single predefined, non-editable message template displayed on the main question card.
Update the "Yes" and "No" response screens to no longer reference recipient/sender names, since names are no longer collected.

Update the predefined (non-editable) romantic message text shown in the main question card (frontend/src/components/valentine/ValentineQuestionCard.tsx) to exactly the new paragraph provided by the user, replacing the existing message paragraph while keeping the rest of the UI unchanged.

Generate a new cute, romantic combined graphic representing the phrase “I love you 1/0”, an infinity motif, and a stamp/seal aesthetic, and add it as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update ONLY the selected element (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/img[1]) in frontend/src/components/valentine/ValentineQuestionCard.tsx: replace its src from /assets/generated/love-seal.dim_256x256.png to /assets/generated/love-seal-infinity-stamp.dim_256x256.png, preserving all other attributes and surrounding UI unchanged.

Update ONLY the selected element (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]) in frontend/src/components/valentine/ValentineQuestionCard.tsx to include 3–5 very small cute pig plushie decorative elements placed around/behind the existing content within that selected area, without changing any other elements or surrounding UI.
Add the required pig plushie image asset(s) as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them for the decorative pig plushie elements in the selected area.

Replace the existing decorative pig plushie images in frontend/src/components/valentine/ValentineQuestionCard.tsx so that there are exactly 5 decorative pig plushies, all positioned at the top area of the card content (no pig plushies placed near the bottom).

Stop using /assets/generated/pig-plushie.dim_256x256.png for the decorative pig plushies, and instead use 5 different pig images sourced from the user-provided images/links (deduplicate identical uploads so the 5 displayed are visually different).

Add the user-provided pig plushie images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from ValentineQuestionCard.tsx (do not hotlink external URLs at runtime). Use the two user-provided URLs as source material to create local static assets.

Remove all decorative pig plushie images from the main question card UI by deleting the five absolutely-positioned pig elements currently rendered near the top of the card in frontend/src/components/valentine/ValentineQuestionCard.tsx, so no pig imagery appears anywhere on the question screen.

Ensure the pig plushie static image assets are no longer referenced anywhere in the frontend codebase after removal (e.g., search for pig-plushie-bunny.dim_256x256.png, pig-plushie-angel.dim_256x256.png, pig-plushie-stack.dim_256x256.png, pig-plushie-blanket.dim_256x256.png, pig-plushie-external-1.dim_256x256.png).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine’s Day website for the user’s wife that asks if she will be their Valentine.
Remove the To/From personalization fields and any editable text box; display only a predefined (non-editable) message template.
Send an email notification to the user once the recipient clicks “Yes/accepts” (include any provided comment in the email).
After the recipient clicks “Yes”, allow them to enter a comment/message and submit it (used in the email notification).
Update the predefined (non-editable) romantic message template shown on the main question card to the new paragraph provided by the user.
Generate and replace the selected UI image asset with a single combined cute/romantic design representing “I love you 1/0”, infinity, and a stamp motif.

projectName: Valentine’s Day proposal website (ask wife to be your Valentine)
